discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The statistic-values parameter allows the user to send statistical values for the metric, such as the Sum, Minimum, Maximum, and SampleCount (Number of Data Points) for a specific period.

By using the put-metric-data command with the statistic-values parameter, the user can send the aggregate values (Sum of data, Min value, Max value, and Number of Data Points) to CloudWatch every hour.

choices.C: Send the data using the put-metric-data command with the statistic-values parameter
choices.D: Send the data using the put-metric-data command with the aggregate ג€"data parameter
choices.A: Send the data using the put-metric-data command with the aggregate-values parameter
choices.B: Send the data using the put-metric-data command with the average-values parameter

questions.question_text:
A user is measuring the CPU utilization of a private data center machine every minute. The machine provides the aggregate of data every hour, such as Sum of data`, `Min value`, `Max value, and `Number of Data points`.
The user wants to send these values to CloudWatch. How can the user achieve this?
questions.answer_description: AWS CloudWatch supports the custom metrics. The user can always capture the custom data and upload the data to CloudWatch using CLI or APIs. The user can publish the data to CloudWatch as single data points or as an aggregated set of data points called a statistic set using the command put-metric-data. When sending the aggregate data, the user needs to send it with the parameter statistic-values:

discussion.content: As of Jan, 2021, 1 minute metrics are now the default w/ SNS: https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2021/01/amazon-sns-now-supports-1-minute-cloudwatch-metrics/

Selected Answer: B
According docs
The metrics you configure with CloudWatch for your Amazon SNS topics are automatically collected and pushed to CloudWatch at 1-minute intervals. These metrics are gathered on all topics that meet the CloudWatch guidelines for being active. A topic is considered active by CloudWatch for up to six hours from the last activity (that is, any API call) on the topic.

There is no charge for the Amazon SNS metrics reported in CloudWatch; they are provided as part of the Amazon SNS service.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/sns-monitoring-using-cloudwatch.html

comments.content: Change to B, this page does not have delete comment section, really bad
sorry, correct my answer to B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
AWS Simple Notification Service (SNS) is a messaging service that enables the user to send notifications and alerts to subscribed endpoints. While SNS integrates with CloudWatch to send notifications based on CloudWatch alarms, it does not provide detailed monitoring data itself.

I would go with number (B). But It may be incorret if this question is too old. 
As of Jan, 2021, the 1 minute metric is the only supported period of logging. It comes enabled by default and AWS enabled it for all users without any additional cost: 
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2021/01/amazon-sns-now-supports-1-minute-cloudwatch-metrics/
D. SNS cannot provide data every minute

choices.B: There is no need to enable since SNS provides data every minute
choices.A: SNS will send data every minute after configuration
choices.D: SNS cannot provide data every minute
choices.C: AWS CloudWatch does not support monitoring for SNS

questions.question_text: A user has enabled detailed CloudWatch monitoring with the AWS Simple Notification Service. Which of the below mentioned statements helps the user understand detailed monitoring better?

discussion.content: Correct Answer: D
answer should be C, since there is no CIDR in same VLAN, unless answer in D is a typo, "20.1.0.0/24" should be "20.0.1.0/24"

Answer is C - There are no overlaps this these subnets. If the Private Subnet cannot communicate with one DC subnet, then it cannot communicate with the other, simply because none is overlapping with the Private subnet.

comments.content:
The VPC is /16. The local route in the routing table contain the entire VPC by default. 

Now that I type it out I am not sure how AWS handle more specific routes. Going to test this

From the question they do not say how the customer is connected to AWS. We assume it is via VPN.

When you add a route that includes a subnet in the VPC it doesn't allow the target to be a Virtual Private gateway. Only an instance or ENI so without some advanced tweaking I don't see it working.

discussion.content: B is the ans, no overlap on the CICD range between 2 networks!
D. It will allow traffic with data center on CIDR 20.1.0.0/24 but does not allow on 20.0.54.0/24

choices.C: It will not allow traffic communication on any of the data center CIDRs
choices.B: It will not allow traffic with data center on CIDR 20.1.0.0/24 but allows traffic communication on 20.0.54.0/24
choices.D: It will allow traffic with data center on CIDR 20.1.0.0/24 but does not allow on 20.0.54.0/24
choices.A: It will allow traffic communication on both the CIDRs of the data center

questions.question_text:
A user has setup a VPC with CIDR 20.0.0.0/16. The VPC has a private subnet (20.0.1.0/24. and a public subnet (20.0.0.0/24.. The user's data center has CIDR of
20.0.54.0/24 and 20.1.0.0/24. If the private subnet wants to communicate with the data center, what will happen?
questions.answer_description:
VPC allows the user to set up a connection between his VPC and corporate or home network data center. If the user has an IP address prefix in the VPC that overlaps with one of the networks' prefixes, any traffic to the network's prefix is dropped. In this case CIDR 20.0.54.0/24 falls in the VPC's CIDR range of
20.0.0.0/16. Thus, it will not allow traffic on that IP. In the case of 20.1.0.0/24, it does not fall in the VPC's CIDR range. Thus, traffic will be allowed on it.

questions.question_text: A user wants to find the particular error that occurred on a certain date in the AWS MySQL RDS DB. Which of the below mentioned activities may help the user to get the data easily?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To find a particular error that occurred on a certain date in an AWS MySQL RDS DB, the user can enable the MySQL error log and configure it to send logs to a database table. By directing the logs to a DB table, the user can easily query and search for specific records based on the date or any other criteria.
Correct Answer: C
C. Direct the logs to the DB table and then query that table

questions.answer_description:
The user can view, download, and watch the database logs using the Amazon RDS console, the Command Line Interface (CLI. or the Amazon RDS API. For the
MySQL RDS, the user can view the error log, slow query log, and general logs. The user can also view the MySQL logs easily by directing the logs to a database table in the main database and querying that table.

choices.A: It is not possible to get the log files for MySQL RDS
choices.D: Download the log file to DynamoDB and search for the record
choices.C: Direct the logs to the DB table and then query that table
choices.B: Find all the transaction logs and query on those records

choices.A: The size of a request is limited to 8KB for HTTP GET requests and 40KB for HTTP POST requests
choices.D: The size of a request is limited to 16KB for HTTP GET requests and 80KB for HTTP POST requests
choices.C: The size of a request is limited to 40KB for HTTP GET requests and 8KB for HTTP POST requests
choices.B: The size of a request is limited to 128KB for HTTP GET requests and 64KB for HTTP POST requests

questions.question_text: A user is trying to send custom metrics to CloudWatch using the PutMetricData APIs. Which of the below mentioned points should the user needs to take care while sending the data to CloudWatch?

discussion.content:
All the answers are out of date
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_PutMetricData.html

Selected Answer: A
When sending custom metrics to CloudWatch using the PutMetricData API, it's important for the user to be aware of the request size limits. For HTTP GET requests, the maximum size of a request is 8KB, and for HTTP POST requests, the maximum size is 40KB. These limits ensure efficient and manageable data transfer to CloudWatch.
Correct Answer: A
Answer is A.
A. The size of a request is limited to 8KB for HTTP GET requests and 40KB for HTTP POST requests

questions.answer_description:
With AWS CloudWatch, the user can publish data points for a metric that share not only the same time stamp, but also the same namespace and dimensions.
CloudWatch can accept multiple data points in the same PutMetricData call with the same time stamp. The only thing that the user needs to take care of is that the size of a PutMetricData request is limited to 8KB for HTTP GET requests and 40KB for HTTP POST requests.
